CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12 reads: "Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the "Hot Mikado" Bill "Bojangles" Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and he comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of the city, a veritable goodwill ambassador. 4 .Bill as the Hot Mikado, surrounded by his dancing girls."
TitMainTitle: Bill "Bojangles" Robinson and female cast members on steps on stage in production of "The Hot Mikado" with pagoda painted on wall in background, Nixon Theater
